org.jetel.hadoop.service.mapreduce

Class HadoopMapReduceConnectionData

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.hadoop.service.AbstractHadoopConnectionData
      • org.jetel.hadoop.service.mapreduce.HadoopMapReduceConnectionData

  • public class HadoopMapReduceConnectionData
extends AbstractHadoopConnectionData
    Represents set settings that are required to create connection to jobtracter of Hadoop cluser. This is bean class that just the wraps required configuration data. This class is immutable.
    Since:
    rel-3-4-0-M2
    See Also:
    HadoopConnectingMapReduceService#connect(HadoopMapReduceConnectionData, Properties)

      Constructs new instance initializing information needed for connection.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HadoopMapReduceConnectionData

        public HadoopMapReduceConnectionData(java.lang.String fsMasterHost,
                             int fsMasterPort,
                             java.lang.String fsUrlTemplate,
                             java.lang.String jobtrackerHost,
                             int jobtrackerPort,
                             java.lang.String user)
        Constructs new instance initializing information needed for connection.
        Parameters:
        fsMasterHost - Host address for communicating with Hadoop cluster file system. For example, if the file system is HDFS, this is host address of cluster namenode. May not be null nor empty.
        fsMasterPort - Port for communication with Hadoop cluster file system. For example, if the file system is HDFS, this is port used by namenode. May not be negative.
        fsUrlTemplate - A template string that is provided by method HadoopFileSystemService.getFSMasterURLTemplate(). This is formating template to be used as first argument of String.format(String, Object...). When following 2 attributes are file system host and port the returned value of String.format(String, Object...) must be url for connecting to cluster file system.
        jobtrackerHost - Host address of jobtracker of the cluster. May not be null nor empty.
        jobtrackerPort - Port for communication with jobtracker of the Hadoop cluster. May not be negative.
        user - User that is connecting to Hadoop cluster.

    • Method Detail

      • isCorrectFsUrlTemplate

        protected boolean isCorrectFsUrlTemplate(java.lang.String fsUrlTemplate)
        Indicates if given string is correct String.format(String, Object...) template for Hadoop file system url.
        Parameters:
        fsUrlTemplate - The template in question.
        Returns:
        true iff the template string contains substring "%s" at least 2 times.

      • getFsMasterHost

        public java.lang.String getFsMasterHost()
        Gets file system host address.
        Returns:
        Host address for communicating with Hadoop cluster file system. For example, if the file system is HDFS, this is host address of cluster namenode. Granted to be non-null nor empty.

      • getFsMasterPort

        public int getFsMasterPort()
        Gets port for communicating with Hadoop file system.
        Returns:
        Port for communication with Hadoop cluster file system. For example, if the file system is HDFS, this is port used by namenode.

      • getJobtrackerHost

        public java.lang.String getJobtrackerHost()
        Gets jobtracter's host address.
        Returns:
        Host address of jobtracker of the cluster. Granted to be non-null nor empty string.

      • getJobtrackerPort

        public int getJobtrackerPort()
        Gets jobtracter's port.
        Returns:
        Port for communication with jobtracker of the Hadoop cluster.

      • getFsUrlTemplate

        public java.lang.String getFsUrlTemplate()
        Gets template for creating Hadoop files system url from host address and port.
        Returns:
        Formating template to be used as first argument of String.format(String, Object...). When following 2 attributes are file system host and port the returned value of String.format(String, Object...) must be url for connecting to cluster file system. Granted to be non-null nor empty string.
